特記事項: 【合併】Seminar in Global Communication　（大学院共通科目・認定科目前期）/Seminar in Global Communication　（経営戦略研究科）
関連科目: Career Seminar for International Organizations, Internship in the United Nations, Management of International Organizations
授業の概要・背景: The seminar will be taught by senior UN and other international practitioners and experts, so that students will be able to learn the latest practical skills from hands-on global communication experience and best practices.

第1回: 4/13 Introduction and overview of the class, objectives, expectations by students
Read the job description of a post and summarize key knowledge, competencies and career paths that you are required to have if you are to apply for the post. (One-page report)
第2回:
4/20 Communication theory
Communication channels and tools
Assessment of communication needs
Read through the Polio Communication Global Guide, and identify the most important communication strategies to end polio and reach zero case.
第3回:
4/27 Development of communication strategies:
Using tool kits
Examples from field offices and RC office
Assignment: Search for and critique a UN agency’s regional or country office communication strategy, and prepare a 3 slides-3 min presentation
第4回:
5/11 Communication and diversity: Cross-cultural communication
UN English writing standards and house style:
Assignment: Prepare one-page UN house style report on your personal cross-cultural communication experience, challenges, and improved approaches
第5回: 5/18 Purpose and principles of UN's global communication: (Guest) UN Department of Global Communications. UN’s overall communication is coordinated based on well-defined communication strategy.
Assignment: Select a specific communication activity of UNHQ and relate it with UN's global communication strategy
第6回:
5/25  Communication opportunities:
Presentation and public speaking, Advocacy and persuasive communication processes
第7回:
6/1  Programme communication: 
Immunization and other health issues
Ebola outbreak and risk communication
Assignment: Develop a communication strategy for promoting human rights in a specific country and prepare a 3-slide presentation
第8回:
6/8  Communication for social change
Advocacy and policy advice
Social innovation process
Changing for sustainable impact
第9回:
6/15 Branding and marketing principles:
UNICEF’s branding strategy
Using marketing strategies
Social marketing
Assignment: Students Search for a UN agency's branding strategy and compare it with UNICEF’s. Prepare 3 slides presentation.
第10回:
6/22 Use of latest technologies and social media
Social media guidelines
Impact assessment and risks
Assignment: Students analyse their own SNS use and develop a communication strategy for their personal branding. 2-slides presentation
第11回: 6/29 (Prof. Tagashira) Communication strategy of UN DESA (Department of Economic and Social Affairs): What is participatory dialogue/multi-stakeholder dialogue, and how does it enable building a more inclusive, safe, and just society for all people?  Understanding the concept behind social inclusion and how it can transform negative social relations such as fragmentation, exclusion, and polarization into positive ones. Introduce some dialogue and mediation examples.   (Guatemala, Guyana, US (native-American vs mainstream American), mediation skills)
Assignment: Assignments:  Students read the publication "Participatory Dialogue: Towards a Stable, Safe and Just Society for All", Chapter 1.  United Nations, ST/ESA/310 (2007)
第12回:
7/6 Handling media interviews and other public relations opportunities:
Talking to the media, TV and radio
Hard talk
Ambush interview
Assignment: Listen to BBC’s hard talk with ex-UNSG Kofi Anan, and identify which part was the most difficult question and assess how Kofi Anan managed. (one-pager)
第13回:
7/13 Case study (Dr. Rintaro Mori, former Regional Adviser for UNFPA)
United Nations Population Fund is one of the UN agencies dealing with population matters, yet it has been focused on sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR). UNFPA has been rolling out a regional campaign on the importance of SRHR in the context of emerging population trends such as population ageing and rapid fertility decline called the life-cycle approach to ageing (#ForEveryAge) in the Asia Pacific region. This session explores the motivations and methodologies employed in the campaign and discusses the possible lessons learnt from the process.
Assignment: Students prepare communication strategies on specific issues of their choice
第14回:
7/20 Students' presentation on communication strategy on specific issues
Evaluation of presentation and class evaluation
